description.plain:
VEDO is an American singer-songwriter born in Michigan.

At 13 years old he moved to Atlanta with his dad because of bad behavior in his mom’s house and in school.  Since he was doing bad at school his father made him an ultimatum saying that if he doesn’t get good grades he’ll quit music. He eventually changed his ways and graduated with honors.

His first single as an artist was Traffic Jam, posted in 2011. In the same year, he released a mixtape called Rnb Monsta Vol. 1 on bandcamp. In the same platform, he released the second volume of Rnb Monsta, a Christmas EP, Certified Banger, She got that Bass and In this Room  (These last three were released in 2012).

In 2013, he appeared on the fourth season of The Voice where he reached the TOP 12 being eliminated in this stage.

Two years after he realeased his first mixtape “93” where is his most famous song “4 Walls” feautiring Natasha Mosley.

“State of Mind” and As I Am were the next records that fans got the chance to hear, both in 2016.

But his debut album, from a label that he created New WAV Music Group, only came out in 2017, called From Now On.

In the next year, 2018, he wrote “Freaky Friday” by Lil Dicky and Chris Brown with 7 other people.

In 2019 he released his second official album, VEDO.

In the year after he came out with For You.

He also has a series of videos on his channel remixing famous songs, both from the past and the present. One of them, Girls Need Love, blew up on TikTok.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=euvbMPL6pMM

VEDO is an American singer-songwriter born in Michigan.

At 13 years old he moved to Atlanta with his dad because of bad behavior in his mom’s house and in school.  Since he was doing bad at school his father made him an ultimatum saying that if he doesn’t get good grades he’ll quit music. He eventually changed his ways and graduated with honors.

His first single as an artist was Traffic Jam, posted in 2011. In the same year, he released a mixtape called Rnb Monsta Vol. 1 on bandcamp. In the same platform, he released the second volume of Rnb Monsta, a Christmas EP, Certified Banger, She got that Bass and In this Room  (These last three were released in 2012).

In 2013, he appeared on the fourth season of The Voice where he reached the TOP 12 being eliminated in this stage.

Two years after he realeased his first mixtape “93” where is his most famous song “4 Walls” feautiring Natasha Mosley.

“State of Mind” and As I Am were the next records that fans got the chance to hear, both in 2016.

But his debut album, from a label that he created New WAV Music Group, only came out in 2017, called From Now On.

In the next year, 2018, he wrote “Freaky Friday” by Lil Dicky and Chris Brown with 7 other people.

In 2019 he released his second official album, VEDO.

In the year after he came out with For You.

He also has a series of videos on his channel remixing famous songs, both from the past and the present. One of them, Girls Need Love, blew up on TikTok.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=euvbMPL6pMM

songs.title: You Got It

description.plain: This Is VEDO’s 7th Song From His 2020 Album; For You. It Was First Seen On The Popular App TikTok And It´s Been Getting More Popular Ever Since. Mixes/Remixes, Dances, And More Have Been Made Since It’s Been Very Popular. And It’s Been On The Radio Multiple Times Because Of It´s Popularity.
